text:
On tap, @T-Anker, Praga. Viaje 03/2017
Color dorado, aromas ligero a lupulo, el sabor es maltoso seguido de algo de lupulo, buen cuerpo, cerveza agradable.
On tap. Pours clear amber with big creamy white head. Aroma is malty, herbal. Taste is moderate sweet, light bitter, malty, caramel mouthfeel. Medium body, slick texture, bitter finish.

Bottle 750ml. @ [ The Country Stat Improver Tasting ] - Saxo, Aarhus. [ As Matuka Knír 14% ].Clear medium orange color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, pale malt, fruity malt, caramel, sweet malt, light bread, light moderate hoppy, fruity hops, grass. Flavor is moderate moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, fruity malt, fruity hops, grass, pale malt, fruity, light bread. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20161008]
 7-4-7-3-15
on tap at Kulovy Blesk. Hazy dark golden with medium creamy white head. Aroma: malt, noble hops, light yeasty. Taste: hops, malt, bread. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Very good.

On tap at Maleický mikropivovar, Prague. Pours almost clear deep golden with a big creamy off-white head. Aroma is malty, weak peppery hops. Taste is good balanced, soft mouthfeel, dry clean bitter herbal and peppery finish, very good.
Bottle at Aarhus tasting. Pours hazy golden with a lasting off white head. Aroma of caramel, malt, light hop, fruit. Medium sweetness, less bitterness. Light body, quite high carbonation.
Bottle Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Modetate malty and light hoppy aroma. Light bitter flavor. Average light bitter finish. oily palate. Nice.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting, my place. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are caramel, fruits, malt and hops. Sweet fruity finish.

Bottle, 5.8%. Clear amber with big off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, hops, herbal, little bread and grass. Flavour is malt, caramel, grass, straw, little herbal, medium sweet, hop and a little bitter.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy dark golden with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 081016

Draught @ T-Anker, Prague. Pours dark golden with an offwhite head, some lacing. Aroma of malt, caramel, bread, grass, some light fruity hops. Flavor is light sweet, malt, caramel, bread, little nuts, grass, fruit. Medium body, average carbonation. 170816

Lahev: Deep golden, almost clear, bigger creamy off-white head; caramelly-nutty nose, some noble-hops underneath; moderate bitter-sweet flavour, medium bodied and pretty soft; becomes drier towards the bitter-hoppy and caramelly finish. Another goody from Broumy

Keg @ Zly Casy. Clear golden with a dense, long lasting, white head, good lacing. Mild floral aroma with some sweet caramel malt. Really smooth mouthfeel, mild carbonated. Floral bitterness up front, grassy with soap, followed by pleasant caramel sweetness, honey and black tea. Mid-dry chalky finish.

Clear golden with big white head. Aroma is fruity hoppy (passion fruit) a little pine cone, butter. Taste is at first citrussy sour, butter and hoppy bitterness come later. Long finish of fruity hops. Sadly it is quite watery. Decent.

Tap at T-Anker. Rather clear golden color with big eggshell head. Aroma is buttery, minerally, piney, a bit fruity, also a nice malty base. Taste is malty, bitter piney and earthy-herbal bitterness, very bitter finish. Minerally-buttery as well, but in a nice way. Rather low carbonation.

Blonde dorée carbo moyenne petit collet. 
Aromes très floral et herbeux. 
Corps moyen bien équilibré, floral encore, manque un peu de longueur mais au final cest une fois de plus une réussite de Matuska.
Aroma: hay, floral, soap. Appearance: amber, cloudy, white minimal foam. Taste: medium bitter, light sweet. Palate: medium body, light texture, average carb, astringent, medium bitter aftertaste.
Bottle. Pours amber with small white head. Aroma:Flowers, hay, berries. Taste is bitter a bit, soap, grapefruit, malty. Thin + body. Ok beer.

Cloudy orange liquid with yellowish head. Aroma of soap, hay flowers and fruits. Taste has also soap, grapefruit seeds, light sweet, medium bitter, light sour. medium body, light feel, average carb, long finish.
On tap. This is more Czech pilsner then polotmavy, at least in taste and aroma. Amber color, clear liquid, white head. Aroma is hoppy, taste is medium bitter. Also in finish. Good lager.

Výčap Beergeek Bar. Tmavia zlatá farba, biela pena. Vôňa sladová, kvasnicová, jemne citrusová. Chuť trávová, horká a sladká zároveň. Na začiatku horkossť, potom sladkosť. Maslové tóny. Dosť zlé pivo.

Bottled, Cesky Brod, CZ, Malt,some bread,caramel and citrusy aroma, Bit hazy dark golden color, smaller lasting head, Sweeter taste, decent bitter ending, Soft carbon, Medium body, Original polotmavy.
Tap at Kulovy Blesk. Golden color with medium white head. Hoppy aroma with light hops. Hoppy taste with solid malty backbone. Long hoppy bitter finish
Tap at Zly casy. Not very good. Quite oxidized, stale impression. That is all I got to say about it.

Bottle 0,75l. Little cloudy, light amber colored beer. Sweet malty aroma, tones of caramel and some fruit- apples. Moderately full bodied, medium dry, flavor of malts, caramel, nice Czech citrusy hops, moderately bitter. Quite nice Czech amber lager.

Bottle 0,75l from Pivotéka Děčín, CZ. Light amber body with very high frothy head. The aroma is predominately malty with notes of bread, yeast, roasted sunflower seeds. Taste is moderate bitter, little sweet and sour. Nice taste of high quality hops  citrusy, bitterness, floral tones, herbs, spices. End with sunflower seeds again, aftertaste bitter. Medium body, high carbonation.Good one.

Decent polotmave, although is a bit special. Appeared bronze/dark with unstable foam. Aroma not very impressive but with decent amount of malts and some bread. Body is very malted with unexpected state of alcohol. And the alcohol notes spoil a bit the finish. But overall is very nice and drinkable in a company.

Bottle. Amber copper color, hazy body, with low whi teh ead. Aroma is malty, noble. Taste has high noble bitterness, low to medium malty sweetness with light hints of caramel. Body is full, medium carbonation.

on tap at klub malych pivovaru. in pretty good shape - amber with a fluffy, lasting white head, somewhat splotchy; aroma of salted caramel, appleskin, lawn bowl green; plenty of bitterness as expected with matuska, well-balanced, weeds, tasty. a pretty good chance of getting to the top of the polotmavy charts

(tap 0,5l @ OP (Brno))
Aroma: Malty, bread/rye/spicy.
Appearance: Cloudy, dark golden color. Medium, white head.
Taste: Medium sweet, light bitter, malty (bread/rye).
Palate: Medium-full body. Light bitter finish.
Overall: Tasty.
On tap. Clear orange color with white head. Aroma - Caramel, bread, malts. Spicy taste with hops and caramel.

Bottle. Matuskas Movember beer. Pours Amber with an off White head. Lagery character with plenty of malt. Bready with a bit of citrus and some oily Saaz like characteristics. Im always exited to see a new Matuska, this one didnt really deliver.

Dark orange colour, white head. Aroma of yeast, lemon zest, dough, bread, mats. Taste is light sweet, light bitter, well balanced. Light to medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Very drinkable.
